intro: Eschscholzia ramosa, commonly known as the slender bush poppy, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, bright orange to red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs. Eschscholzia ramosa is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species known for their medicinal and ornamental value.
